text: Mark J Heller is well known as being
very colorful a very controversial
lawyer this was too good of a New York
story not to do so we decided we'd
explore his legal career back in 1977
when the Son of Sam was arrested for a
brief period about a month mr. Heller
was on his legal team we thought since
mr. Heller had been making a big deal
about it representing the Son of Sam
that it would be a good idea to talk to
mr. Berkowitz and it struck us as as
interesting that one of mr. Heller's
biggest fans does happen to be a serial
killer I like mark it was just very
easygoing guy and look like a college
student almost kind of more like my age
I certainly haven't reviewed a lot of
people who were notorious that this was
the first jailhouse interview I'd done
with a serial killer and we found it to
be very revealing in terms of what he
had to say about mr. Heller and his more
recent encounters with him and out of
nowhere he wrote me a letter just to say
hi tell me what was going on in his life
it was a friendly letter unbeknownst to
him I was going through a difficult time
with another attorney a attorney who I
had given all my property to to keep in
storage you know personal photos
mementos and the next thing mr.
Berkowitz news mr. Heller his son and
his daughter were working on this case
for him pro bono because mr. berkowitz
had no money mr. Berkowitz estimates
they put in several hundred hours and a
settlement was finally reaching the case
and mr. Burke would seem very happy and
eternally grateful to him and his family
for helping him well me personally I see
the hand of God in it because I'm a
Christian and I was fervently praying
you know God please help me with this
situation this other lawyer I mean has
just taking everything and cleaned me
out he's got all kinds of plans to
market this or that and I just feel you
know really helpless victimized
whatever I believe that God put it in
his heart to think about me to write to
me because it couldn't have come at a
more perfect time the relationship seems
to be fairly close in that before we
went up to interview mr. Berkowitz mr.
brookwood said he actually called mr.
Heller to let him know that we were
coming I wrote a nice letter you know so
I'm so grateful for all the market mr.
Howard done for me and so I read letter
to him over the phone you know I thought
he'd be excited about it yeah would you
know it was interesting and perplexing
to us that somebody who who has had a
lot of experience you know with the
media declined you know numerous
requests we made via phone by email in
person at his office for an interview we
still are not quite sure why
